conclusion: To find the angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C, analyze the motion from point B to point C.
The slider is ejected from point B with an initial velocity v_B, which is horizontal.
The slider follows a projectile motion from point B to point C, with horizontal distance x_BC = 0.9 m and vertical drop h = 0.53 m.
Calculate the time of flight using the vertical motion equation: t = sqrt(2h/g) = sqrt(2 * 0.53 / 9.8) ≈ 0.33 s.
Calculate the horizontal velocity: v_B = x_BC / t = 0.9 / 0.33 ≈ 2.73 m/s.
Calculate the vertical velocity at point C: v_yC = g * t = 9.8 * 0.33 ≈ 3.23 m/s.
Determine the angle of the velocity at point C using the tangent function: tan φ = v_yC / v_B = 3.23 / 2.73 ≈ 1.18.
Calculate the angle φ: φ = tan^(-1)(1.18) ≈ 50°.
The angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C is approximately 50°.
